intro: Platymetra, commonly known as the broadleaf arrowhead, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. These plants are characterized by their arrow-shaped leaves and are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They typically grow in wet, marshy environments and are often found in swamps or along the edges of ponds. Platymetra species are known for their striking, spatulate-shaped flowers that are usually green or white in color. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
